summary: This is a U.S. Attorney's Office press release announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell on charges of conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticement, transportation, and perjury related to 2016 depositions. It details the allegations of grooming and abuse spanning from 1994 to 1997 across multiple locations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticement, transportation, and perjury. Alleged to have played a critical role in grooming and abusing victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier alleged to have sexually abused minor girls with the assistance of Ghislaine Maxwell. Described as having a preference for young girls.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Announced the charges against Maxwell and made a statement condemning her alleged role in facilitating Epstein's abuse of minors.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Announced the charges and made a statement praising the bravery of the victims and condemning Maxwell's actions.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Announced the charges and commended investigators for their work in seeking justice for survivors of sexual assault.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Assigned to preside over Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, transport, and sexually abuse minor girls.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated, aided, and participated in Epstein's sexual abuse of minors, and in some cases abused them herself.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged in a Manhattan federal court indictment with conspiracy to sexually abuse minors with Jeffrey Epstein and perjury.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein exploited girls as young as 14, enticing them to travel for illegal sex acts during this period.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with perjury for making false statements under oath during a civil deposition in 2016.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was to be presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors.
The indictment alleges Maxwell groomed victims as young as 14 from at least 1994 to 1997, facilitating their abuse in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and her London residence.
Maxwell is charged with two perjury counts related to false statements made during a 2016 civil deposition.
The press release includes statements from top law enforcement officials praising the victims' bravery and condemning the alleged crimes.
The case is assigned to U.S. District Judge Alison J. Nathan.
